description: Log_b 2 where b is smallest primitive root (A001918) mod n-th prime.
references: T. M. Apostol, Introduction to Analytic Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, Table 10.2, pp. 216-217.
example: Smallest primitive root mod 7 is 3; 2 = 3^2 mod 7; 7 is 4th prime; so a(4) = 2.
crossrefs: Cf. table in A054503. Also A054506-A054513.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 09 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 09 2000
